programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In Florida Keys, in 1991, a young woman is last seen alive hitch-hiking on Valentines Day. The next day, her body is discovered along a deserted road.

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: A welfare check requested by two concerned grandkids on the 29th February 2004 results in the discovery of the badly decomposed bodies of Carolee and Duane Recob. For Lieutenant Scot Stefanczyk, this is the first murder he has investigated, but with the help of the local DCI and the FBI, he uncovers a sickening crime motivated by money.

programme.title: Murdered at First Sight
programme.desc: Most killers know their victims, Murdered At First Sight investigates the alarming rise in "Stranger Murders" and the challenges faced by the police in tracking down the suspect of an entirely random homicide.

programme.title: CI Australia: Families Of Crime
programme.desc: Dubbed Mr Sin and the Boss of the Cross, Abe Saffron ruled his family with an iron fist. A tireless womaniser, he even had his son, Alan, committed to the infamous Chelmsford Psychiatric Hospital and denied him access to his own children. Saffrons alleged criminal activities included illegal alcohol sales, dealing in stolen goods, illegal gambling, prostitution, drug dealing, bribery, extortion and murder. Most charges laid against him involved minor firearms or liquor licensing offences, but late in his life he finally served 17 months in jail for tax evasion. He died in 2006, aged 86. The people in Saffrons life include a wife, Doreen, his son Alan (who has written a tell-all book about his father), grandchildren, former mistresses and a host of police, prostitutes, strippers, celebrities and gangsters. This episode features an interview with Alan Saffron.

programme.title: Homicide With Ron Iddles
programme.desc: One of Australias greatest detectives reveals the untold stories of his most challenging cases. This series takes you behind the news headlines, on a minute-by-minute journey with Ron Iddles.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: In Cincinnati, a well-loved 58-year-old man is found shot dead in a hallway, still clutching a five-dollar bill. Detectives Matt Thompson and Doug Lindle visit the grief-stricken wife and learn the victim was murdered a day before his birthday. Thompson and Lindle rely on the help of the community to track down the suspects last seen with the victim moments before he was murdered.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.sub-title: Welch and Bastian - Mystery In The Parks
programme.desc: In Tacoma, Washington State, in 1986, 12-year-old Michella Welch goes missing in Puget Park. That night, police locate her badly bludgeoned body and there is evidence of sexual assault.

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: When 26-year-old Wendy Mann is discovered strangled in her own home in August 2015, the police immediately suspect her married lover. However, while he is in custody held on suspicion of her murder, a tangled web of lies is uncovered, and the real killer is revealed.

programme.title: Cops Reloaded
programme.desc: Cops Reloaded revisits some of the most memorable suspects, car chases and action-packed moments from televisions popular reality program.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Television cameras follow real-life law enforcement officers and capture the action as they perform their daily duty to serve and protect the public.

programme.title: Click For Murder
programme.desc: Chilling series reveals disturbing crimes in recent history where the internet has been used to trick, torture, and kill victims lured from a virtual world.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia
programme.sub-title: A Killer Amongst Us - The Norfolk Island Murder
programme.desc: On Easter Sunday, 2002, on sleepy Norfolk Island in the south west Pacific, the body of 29-year-old Janelle Patton was found lying in an open field. Shed been stabbed to death in a frenzied attack that had left more than 60 wounds from her head to her feet. She had multiple bruises and broken bones and it was clear she had bravely fought back against a sustained attack. Glass fragments in her hair indicated she had been bashed around the head with a wine bottle. Although her clothes had been neatly cut away from her body, there was no evidence that she had been raped. The killing made news around the world. It was the first murder in more than a hundred years on an island famous for its history as a brutal penal colony and as home to the descendants of the notorious Bounty mutineers. With just 2771 residents and visitors on the island at the time, it was widely expected that the killer would be quickly identified and brought to justice.

programme.title: #textmewhenyougethome
programme.desc: #TextMeWhenYouGetHome became a viral, worldwide movement following the 2021 death of Sarah Everard. The slogan sparked awareness around the vulnerability women feel while out in public alone.

programme.title: Hours To Kill
programme.desc: On Easter Sunday in Massachusetts, police find the remains of a 24-year-old woman. It takes 25 years and advances in DNA technology for a determined DA to finally solve the case.

programme.title: Click For Murder
programme.desc: Chilling series reveals disturbing crimes in recent history where the internet has been used to trick, torture, and kill victims lured from a virtual world.

programme.title: I Survived a Crime
programme.desc: A man brutally attacks multiple people during an auto store robbery. A woman with an unusual weapon fends off an alleged serial thief. A woman is carjacked by a wanted fugitive in the middle of a shootout with police; and more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: While standing outside of a motorcycle gangs clubhouse, two witnesses watch in horror as a truck intentionally runs over an unconscious man, not once, but twice. Fearing for their safety, the witnesses run into the clubhouse, but when they look outside, both the truck and the victim are gone. The truck was finally located, but the forensics lab could not find a single speck of evidence in it. And the body didnt turn up either.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The bomb was constructed to cause as much damage as possible - and it did, killing the victim with deadly force and flame. A painstaking search yielded tiny clues, which identified the killer as surely as if hed signed them.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For seven years, a trio of men robbed one bank after another. They always got away before the police arrived, and they left no evidence behind. But the way they stood and the clothes they wore told a story a story that could be read by forensic scientists.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: In Dallas, a man is shot to death while trying to protect a friend outside a crowded nightclub. With little physical evidence to go on, Detective Robert Quirk must convince reluctant witnesses to tell him who pulled the trigger. In Detroit, a warm spring day turns deadly when a basketball game erupts in violence. To discover who fired the fatal shot, its up to officer Jo Ann Miller to track down the players one by one.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.sub-title: Pamela Cahanes - Murder By The Base
programme.desc: In Sanford, Florida, in 1984, the bruised and bloodied body of 25-year-old naval recruit Pamela Cahanes is found in an abandoned lot near the Naval Training Center.

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: When the police are called to a house fire in June 2009, arson is quickly suspected. All four children in the Masud family are critically injured but daughters Maleha and Nabitha succumb to their injuries. The local community is shocked even more, when a 14-year-old boy is arrested and charged with murder.

programme.title: Hoarders
programme.desc: From the outside their houses look normal. But inside a family is struggling to keep ahead of the insignificant things that have taken over their lives.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain
programme.desc: In 1991 newly qualified nurse, Beverley Allitt, carried out despicable crimes. Instead of caring for children on her ward, she was murdering them. In 1993 after months of detective work she was convicted of killing four children and severely injuring a further nine. To most parents and colleagues she appeared helpful and friendly. But once left alone with the patients she murdered babies and children through fatal injections or suffocation. Child after child was collapsing on the ward but none of the staff could understand why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police determine that the human remains found in a discarded box belong to one Edna Posey. But to find out when the murder took place, and whether the man accused of the crime is guilty, investigators turn to insects and the forensic entomologist who can interpret their behaviour.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 12-year-old girl claimed she had been abducted and sexually assaulted. She recounted what happened in such a flat, unemotional voice that police found it difficult to believe her. Fibres on her clothing would prove she was telling the truth, and help police to find her attacker.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman suddenly becomes critically ill; her symptoms worsen over time, eventually leaving her unable to walk. Then a bone marrow test reveals the cause: arsenic. programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: When the police are called to a house fire in June 2009, arson is quickly suspected. All four children in the Masud family are critically injured but daughters Maleha and Nabitha succumb to their injuries. The local community is shocked even more, when a 14-year-old boy is arrested and charged with murder.

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: In 1986, Carol Taggart disappears and is found murdered. Her son Ross is convicted, but retains control of her assets, prompting a campaign for legal reform.

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: In May 1997, 8-year-old Jamie Lavis vanishes. Bus driver Darren Vickers, initially a suspect, is arrested after Jamies remains are found. Vickers is convicted of Jamies abduction and murder in 1999.

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: In 1989, Surjit disappears. In 2007, her mother-in-law and husband are convicted of her honor-based murder. Sarbjit, her sister-in-law, later founds a charity for abused women.

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: Reveals how the deadliest crimes are solved by the only witnesses that never lie, and where murderers have no place to hide: surveillance cameras.

programme.title: The Real Manhunter
programme.desc: Following ex-detective Colin Sutton, a former senior investigating officer with the Metropolitan Police, as he looks back at his most important cases and the investigations that solved them.

programme.title: Railway Murders
programme.desc: In December 1985, Alison Day disappeared after getting off a train at Hackney Wick station. Over the next six months, two more women would be snatched at stations across the South East. Across three episodes this landmark series explores the devastating impact of these crimes,

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In Florida Keys, in 1991, a young woman is last seen alive hitch-hiking on Valentines Day. The next day, her body is discovered along a deserted road.

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: A welfare check requested by two concerned grandkids on the 29th February 2004 results in the discovery of the badly decomposed bodies of Carolee and Duane Recob. For Lieutenant Scot Stefanczyk, this is the first murder he has investigated, but with the help of the local DCI and the FBI, he uncovers a sickening crime motivated by money.

programme.title: Murdered at First Sight
programme.desc: Most killers know their victims, Murdered At First Sight investigates the alarming rise in "Stranger Murders" and the challenges faced by the police in tracking down the suspect of an entirely random homicide.

programme.title: CI Australia: Families Of Crime
programme.desc: Dubbed Mr Sin and the Boss of the Cross, Abe Saffron ruled his family with an iron fist. A tireless womaniser, he even had his son, Alan, committed to the infamous Chelmsford Psychiatric Hospital and denied him access to his own children. Saffrons alleged criminal activities included illegal alcohol sales, dealing in stolen goods, illegal gambling, prostitution, drug dealing, bribery, extortion and murder. Most charges laid against him involved minor firearms or liquor licensing offences, but late in his life he finally served 17 months in jail for tax evasion. He died in 2006, aged 86. The people in Saffrons life include a wife, Doreen, his son Alan (who has written a tell-all book about his father), grandchildren, former mistresses and a host of police, prostitutes, strippers, celebrities and gangsters. This episode features an interview with Alan Saffron.

programme.title: Homicide With Ron Iddles
programme.desc: One of Australias greatest detectives reveals the untold stories of his most challenging cases. This series takes you behind the news headlines, on a minute-by-minute journey with Ron Iddles.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: In Cincinnati, a well-loved 58-year-old man is found shot dead in a hallway, still clutching a five-dollar bill. Detectives Matt Thompson and Doug Lindle visit the grief-stricken wife and learn the victim was murdered a day before his birthday. Thompson and Lindle rely on the help of the community to track down the suspects last seen with the victim moments before he was murdered.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.sub-title: Welch and Bastian - Mystery In The Parks
programme.desc: In Tacoma, Washington State, in 1986, 12-year-old Michella Welch goes missing in Puget Park. That night, police locate her badly bludgeoned body and there is evidence of sexual assault.

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: When 26-year-old Wendy Mann is discovered strangled in her own home in August 2015, the police immediately suspect her married lover. However, while he is in custody held on suspicion of her murder, a tangled web of lies is uncovered, and the real killer is revealed.

programme.title: Cops Reloaded
programme.desc: Cops Reloaded revisits some of the most memorable suspects, car chases and action-packed moments from televisions popular reality program.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Television cameras follow real-life law enforcement officers and capture the action as they perform their daily duty to serve and protect the public.

programme.title: Click For Murder
programme.desc: Chilling series reveals disturbing crimes in recent history where the internet has been used to trick, torture, and kill victims lured from a virtual world.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia
programme.sub-title: A Killer Amongst Us - The Norfolk Island Murder
programme.desc: On Easter Sunday, 2002, on sleepy Norfolk Island in the south west Pacific, the body of 29-year-old Janelle Patton was found lying in an open field. Shed been stabbed to death in a frenzied attack that had left more than 60 wounds from her head to her feet. She had multiple bruises and broken bones and it was clear she had bravely fought back against a sustained attack. Glass fragments in her hair indicated she had been bashed around the head with a wine bottle. Although her clothes had been neatly cut away from her body, there was no evidence that she had been raped. The killing made news around the world. It was the first murder in more than a hundred years on an island famous for its history as a brutal penal colony and as home to the descendants of the notorious Bounty mutineers. With just 2771 residents and visitors on the island at the time, it was widely expected that the killer would be quickly identified and brought to justice.

programme.title: #textmewhenyougethome
programme.desc: #TextMeWhenYouGetHome became a viral, worldwide movement following the 2021 death of Sarah Everard. The slogan sparked awareness around the vulnerability women feel while out in public alone.

programme.title: Hours To Kill
programme.desc: On Easter Sunday in Massachusetts, police find the remains of a 24-year-old woman. It takes 25 years and advances in DNA technology for a determined DA to finally solve the case.

programme.desc: Chilling series reveals disturbing crimes in recent history where the internet has been used to trick, torture, and kill victims lured from a virtual world.

programme.title: I Survived a Crime
programme.desc: A man brutally attacks multiple people during an auto store robbery. A woman with an unusual weapon fends off an alleged serial thief. A woman is carjacked by a wanted fugitive in the middle of a shootout with police; and more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: While standing outside of a motorcycle gangs clubhouse, two witnesses watch in horror as a truck intentionally runs over an unconscious man, not once, but twice. Fearing for their safety, the witnesses run into the clubhouse, but when they look outside, both the truck and the victim are gone. The truck was finally located, but the forensics lab could not find a single speck of evidence in it. And the body didnt turn up either.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The bomb was constructed to cause as much damage as possible - and it did, killing the victim with deadly force and flame. A painstaking search yielded tiny clues, which identified the killer as surely as if hed signed them.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For seven years, a trio of men robbed one bank after another. They always got away before the police arrived, and they left no evidence behind. But the way they stood and the clothes they wore told a story a story that could be read by forensic scientists.

programme.desc: In December 1985, Alison Day disappeared after getting off a train at Hackney Wick station. Over the next six months, two more women would be snatched at stations across the South East. Across three episodes this landmark series explores the devastating impact of these crimes,

programme.title: Dogfights
programme.desc: May 1941: The most powerful warship on Earth breaks out into the North Atlantic. The lethal German battleship Bismarck wields enough firepower to single-handedly crush vital British convoys. The British unleash every weapon in their arsenal to hunt down this Nazi terror and pound her into oblivion. Now, relive the fury of the battleships big guns, fly with Swordfish torpedo-bomber pilots desperately trying to stop her, and join the greatest sea chase in history.

programme.title: History Uncovered
programme.sub-title: The Cuban Missile Crisis - Kennedys Defeat
programme.desc: An investigation into the most significant events of the 20th century from an entirely new perspective.

programme.title: Digging For Britain
programme.sub-title: Central: Dinosaur Highway and Roman Sauna
programme.desc: A quarryman makes the discovery of a set of very large footprints. A chance find reveals a spectacular Roman villa with mosaics and a sauna.

programme.title: Line of Fire
programme.desc: The remarkable warriors of the Aztec civilisations come under the spotlight in this episode, which tells the story of the Spanish conquest of the south Americas. Featured is the battle of Tenochtitlan, the Aztec capital, which, despite the capture of the Aztec leader Montezuma, saw the greatest defeat of Spanish forces in nearly fifty years - a victory that would ultimately cost them dear.

programme.title: Dogfights
programme.desc: The sound of jet combat reverberates above the tombs of the Pharaohs as the small Israeli Air Force delivers a knockout punch to the Egyptians in the 1967 Six Day War. Fly in the Mirage III with the IAFs first jet ace Giora Romm as he chases down two MIG-17s over the Suez Canal at dusk. Be in the cockpit with 119 Squadron Commander and ace Ran Ronen as he flies into hostile Jordan for a top-secret rendezvous - arranged by the Israeli Mossad - and later as he speeds deep into enemy territory for a bombing mission that ends up as a swirling dogfight directly over the Egyptian base. Witness the first combat engagement of the McDonnell Douglas F-15 and how Major Moshe Melnik draws first blood for the Eagle in the skies over Lebanon in 1979. Learn how the Israeli Air Force of today hones its capabilities with cutting-edge technology that makes it the most feared opposition in the sky.

programme.title: Secrets of World War II
programme.desc: Throughout occupied Europe, the Nazis systematically plundered the continents museums, galleries and private collections. At the wars end, a massive effort was mounted by the Allies to locate the missing art treasures and return them to their rightful owners.

programme.title: History of Warfare
programme.desc: An evocative program featuring period imagery and reconstructions giving an overview of this turbulent period. With full commentary and analysis by Dr David Chandler, the worlds leading authority on the Emperor Napoleon and author of the definitive reference work The Campaigns of Napoleon.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A team of specialists dig deep to uncover as much as they can in three days about a UK sites archaeology and history.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: Secrets In the Ice is a one-hour factual series that goes to the most remote, cold, and inhospitable places on the planet to reveal great mysteries that were once frozen in time.

programme.title: Massive Engineering Mistakes
programme.desc: In Sweden, tragedy strikes as a landmark bridge is destroyed in seconds. A massive construction disaster occurs at a New Jersey casino. Unanticipated turbulence forces a rethink for Chicagos newest skyscraper.

programme.title: Hitlers Handmaidens
programme.desc: Explores how women are active and often violent participants and perpetrators in the war and its attendant atrocities, specially the Holocaust.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.desc: The architecture of the Nazi regime aimed for a dystopian future, with grand structures like the Nuremberg Rally Grounds and plans for an ideal city, Germania, showcasing their twisted vision.

programme.title: Countdown to Surrender: Last 100 Days
programme.desc: April 16, 1945. The Red Army begins its Berlin offensive. The generals are willing to incur heavy losses. On the Western Front, the first concentration camps have been liberated by British and US forces. They discovered emaciated prisoners and mounds of corpses. Hundreds of thousands of Wehrmacht soldiers surrender. Churchill doesnt want to leave Berlin to Stalin, but Eisenhower has other concerns. He is afraid of German units forming a national redoubt in the Alps. Hitler finally realizes that the war is a lost cause. Only Goebbels and his family remain in the Fuhrers bunker. Hitler and his wife Eva Braun commit suicide on April 30. Nor do the Goebbels family survive the downfall. It is left to administrators under Grand Admiral Doenitz to declare unconditional surrender. On May 8, the Second World War comes to an end in Europe.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: Secrets In the Ice is a one-hour factual series that goes to the most remote, cold, and inhospitable places on the planet to reveal great mysteries that were once frozen in time.

programme.title: Line of Fire
programme.desc: The remarkable warriors of the Aztec civilisations come under the spotlight in this episode, which tells the story of the Spanish conquest of the south Americas. Featured is the battle of Tenochtitlan, the Aztec capital, which, despite the capture of the Aztec leader Montezuma, saw the greatest defeat of Spanish forces in nearly fifty years - a victory that would ultimately cost them dear.

programme.title: Dogfights
programme.desc: The sound of jet combat reverberates above the tombs of the Pharaohs as the small Israeli Air Force delivers a knockout punch to the Egyptians in the 1967 Six Day War. Fly in the Mirage III with the IAFs first jet ace Giora Romm as he chases down two MIG-17s over the Suez Canal at dusk. Be in the cockpit with 119 Squadron Commander and ace Ran Ronen as he flies into hostile Jordan for a top-secret rendezvous - arranged by the Israeli Mossad - and later as he speeds deep into enemy territory for a bombing mission that ends up as a swirling dogfight directly over the Egyptian base. Witness the first combat engagement of the McDonnell Douglas F-15 and how Major Moshe Melnik draws first blood for the Eagle in the skies over Lebanon in 1979. Learn how the Israeli Air Force of today hones its capabilities with cutting-edge technology that makes it the most feared opposition in the sky.

programme.title: Secrets of World War II
programme.desc: Throughout occupied Europe, the Nazis systematically plundered the continents museums, galleries and private collections. At the wars end, a massive effort was mounted by the Allies to locate the missing art treasures and return them to their rightful owners.

programme.title: History of Warfare
programme.desc: An evocative program featuring period imagery and reconstructions giving an overview of this turbulent period. With full commentary and analysis by Dr David Chandler, the worlds leading authority on the Emperor Napoleon and author of the definitive reference work The Campaigns of Napoleon.

programme.title: Hitlers Handmaidens
programme.desc: Explores how women are active and often violent participants and perpetrators in the war and its attendant atrocities, specially the Holocaust.

programme.title: Line of Fire
programme.desc: Persias commanders are known to have at first completely underestimated the Greek Hoplite warriors during the Greek-Persian wars. At Marathon in the year 490BC they were to be punished for their mistake. This episode also looks into the facts behind the great battles at Thermopylae and Salamis - defining moments in a war that saw an eventual Greek victory.

programme.title: Dogfights
programme.desc: Courageous bomber pilots from World War II and Vietnam challenge deadly foes - against incredible odds! Using state-of-the-art computer animation, youre in the cockpit with legendary WWII Navy ace Swede Vejtasas SBD dive bomber as he fights off eight lethal Japanese Zeroe. WWII medal of honour winner Jay Zeamer and his crew pit their slow B-17 bomber against 17 Japanese fighters in a 45-minute battle for survival. Plus, soar with Air Force Lt Col Leo Thorsness as his F-105 Thunderchief takes on a flight of skilled MiG-17s in the skies over Vietnam.

programme.title: Secrets of World War II
programme.desc: It was faster than any British battleship, but in what was to become known as The Battle of the North Cape, the Scharnhorst was about to meet its destiny at the hands of Admiral Fraser in one of the most exciting naval engagements ever.

programme.title: History of Warfare
programme.desc: After months of rising tension, The English Civil War finally exploded into life on the slopes of Edgehill on October 23, 1642. It was to be a confused and bitter business, marked by the foolishness of Prince Rupert and the Royalist cavalry, who left the field at a crucial stage of the battle. As darkness fell, nearly 3000 men lay dead and the die was cast: the English Civil War would be no short and decisive affair.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A team of specialists dig deep to uncover as much as they can in three days about a UK sites archaeology and history.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: Secrets In the Ice is a one-hour factual series that goes to the most remote, cold, and inhospitable places on the planet to reveal great mysteries that were once frozen in time.

programme.title: Field of Vampires
programme.desc: Documents a forensic investigation of ancient skeletons in mysterious graveyards, ground-breaking DNA analysis, and pioneering facial reconstruction techniques.

programme.title: The Last Journey of the Vikings
programme.desc: For most people, Vikings are known only as violent looters, infamous for their swift and brutal raids as they plundered the European coasts for gold and silver. But in this series we will dig deeper and gain more insight into who the Vikings really were.

programme.title: Ancient Apocalypse
programme.desc: The Minoans, considered by many as the first European civilisation, flourished in the islands of the Aegean in the 3rd and 2nd millennia BCE, before eventually disappearing around 1100 BC.

programme.title: Ancient Black Ops
programme.desc: These stone age special forces of the Pacific invented their own martial art, Lua, in which they learned how to snap fingers and break shoulders. In the 18th century, led by their commander Kamehameha, one group of Koa defeated the modern technology of Captain Cook and a band of British marines.

programme.title: The World from Above
programme.sub-title: North Carolina USA - Corolla To New Bern
programme.desc: A breathtaking series of aerial programs offering an entirely different view of the world. From 10,000 feet down to just a few feet above ground, discover new perspectives through thrilling journeys, from mountains and great cities to fantastic castles and the great natural wonders of the globe. This series travels everywhere from Spain to South Africa, from the north of Iceland to North Carolina in the USA.

programme.title: The World from Above
programme.sub-title: New Hampshire USA - Isles Of Shoals To Dartmouth College
programme.desc: A breathtaking series of aerial programs offering an entirely different view of the world. From 10,000 feet down to just a few feet above ground, discover new perspectives through thrilling journeys, from mountains and great cities to fantastic castles and the great natural wonders of the globe. This series travels everywhere from Spain to South Africa, from the north of Iceland to North Carolina in the USA.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Appealing to history buffs and dedicated ramblers alike, Sir Tony Robinson embarks on more walks through some of Britains most spectacular and historic landscapes in search of the richest stories from Britains past. In each program, Tony follows a bespoke route that allows him to explore on foot both the history of a particularly colourful period or event and the spectacular landscape in which those events unfolded. With experts he encounters on the way, Tony reveals and discovers places that ordinary walkers and ramblers might otherwise miss. And he infuses each walk with an appreciation of some of the striking landscapes and geographical features he encounters.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Appealing to history buffs and dedicated ramblers alike, Sir Tony Robinson embarks on spectacular walks through some of Britains most historic landscapes in search of the richest stories from Britains past. In each programme, Tony follows a bespoke route that allows him to explore on foot both the history of a particularly colourful historical period or event, and the spectacular landscape in which those events unfolded. The walks are proper expeditions with each one taking Tony several days. With various experts he encounters on the way, Tony reveals and discovers places and their hidden stories that ordinary walkers and ramblers might otherwise miss. And, as well as the history, Tony infuses each walk with an appreciation of some of the striking landscapes and geographical features Britain contains.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A team of specialists dig deep to uncover as much as they can in three days about a UK sites archaeology and history.

programme.title: Dogfights
programme.desc: May 1941: The most powerful warship on Earth breaks out into the North Atlantic. The lethal German battleship Bismarck wields enough firepower to single-handedly crush vital British convoys. The British unleash every weapon in their arsenal to hunt down this Nazi terror and pound her into oblivion. Now, relive the fury of the battleships big guns, fly with Swordfish torpedo-bomber pilots desperately trying to stop her, and join the greatest sea chase in history.

programme.title: History Uncovered
programme.sub-title: The Cuban Missile Crisis - Kennedys Defeat
programme.desc: An investigation into the most significant events of the 20th century from an entirely new perspective.

programme.title: Digging For Britain
programme.sub-title: Central: Dinosaur Highway and Roman Sauna
programme.desc: A quarryman makes the discovery of a set of very large footprints. A chance find reveals a spectacular Roman villa with mosaics and a sauna.

WWII medal of honour winner Jay Zeamer and his crew pit their slow B-17 bomber against 17 Japanese fighters in a 45-minute battle for survival. Plus, soar with Air Force Lt Col Leo Thorsness as his F-105 Thunderchief takes on a flight of skilled MiG-17s in the skies over Vietnam.

programme.title: Secrets of World War II
programme.desc: It was faster than any British battleship, but in what was to become known as The Battle of the North Cape, the Scharnhorst was about to meet its destiny at the hands of Admiral Fraser in one of the most exciting naval engagements ever.

programme.title: History of Warfare
programme.desc: After months of rising tension, The English Civil War finally exploded into life on the slopes of Edgehill on October 23, 1642. It was to be a confused and bitter business, marked by the foolishness of Prince Rupert and the Royalist cavalry, who left the field at a crucial stage of the battle. As darkness fell, nearly 3000 men lay dead and the die was cast: the English Civil War would be no short and decisive affair.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A team of specialists dig deep to uncover as much as they can in three days about a UK sites archaeology and history.

programme.title: Field of Vampires
programme.desc: Documents a forensic investigation of ancient skeletons in mysterious graveyards, ground-breaking DNA analysis, and pioneering facial reconstruction techniques.

programme.title: The Last Journey of the Vikings
programme.desc: For most people, Vikings are known only as violent looters, infamous for their swift and brutal raids as they plundered the European coasts for gold and silver. But in this series we will dig deeper and gain more insight into who the Vikings really were.

programme.title: Ancient Apocalypse
programme.desc: The Minoans, considered by many as the first European civilisation, flourished in the islands of the Aegean in the 3rd and 2nd millennia BCE, before eventually disappearing around 1100 BC.

programme.title: Ancient Black Ops
programme.desc: These stone age special forces of the Pacific invented their own martial art, Lua, in which they learned how to snap fingers and break shoulders. In the 18th century, led by their commander Kamehameha, one group of Koa defeated the modern technology of Captain Cook and a band of British marines.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A team of specialists dig deep to uncover as much as they can in three days about a UK sites archaeology and history.

programme.title: Line of Fire
programme.desc: Persias commanders are known to have at first completely underestimated the Greek Hoplite warriors during the Greek-Persian wars. At Marathon in the year 490BC they were to be punished for their mistake. This episode also looks into the facts behind the great battles at Thermopylae and Salamis - defining moments in a war that saw an eventual Greek victory.

programme.title: Dogfights
programme.desc: Courageous bomber pilots from World War II and Vietnam challenge deadly foes - against incredible odds! Using state-of-the-art computer animation, youre in the cockpit with legendary WWII Navy ace Swede Vejtasas SBD dive bomber as he fights off eight lethal Japanese Zeroe. WWII medal of honour winner Jay Zeamer and his crew pit their slow B-17 bomber against 17 Japanese fighters in a 45-minute battle for survival. Plus, soar with Air Force Lt Col Leo Thorsness as his F-105 Thunderchief takes on a flight of skilled MiG-17s in the skies over Vietnam.

programme.title: Ancient Apocalypse

programme.title: The World from Above
programme.sub-title: North Carolina USA - Corolla To New Bern
programme.desc: A breathtaking series of aerial programs offering an entirely different view of the world. From 10,000 feet down to just a few feet above ground, discover new perspectives through thrilling journeys, from mountains and great cities to fantastic castles and the great natural wonders of the globe. This series travels everywhere from Spain to South Africa, from the north of Iceland to North Carolina in the USA.

programme.title: The World from Above
programme.sub-title: New Hampshire USA - Isles Of Shoals To Dartmouth College
programme.desc: A breathtaking series of aerial programs offering an entirely different view of the world. From 10,000 feet down to just a few feet above ground, discover new perspectives through thrilling journeys, from mountains and great cities to fantastic castles and the great natural wonders of the globe. This series travels everywhere from Spain to South Africa, from the north of Iceland to North Carolina in the USA.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Appealing to history buffs and dedicated ramblers alike, Sir Tony Robinson embarks on more walks through some of Britains most spectacular and historic landscapes in search of the richest stories from Britains past. In each program, Tony follows a bespoke route that allows him to explore on foot both the history of a particularly colourful period or event and the spectacular landscape in which those events unfolded. With experts he encounters on the way, Tony reveals and discovers places that ordinary walkers and ramblers might otherwise miss. And he infuses each walk with an appreciation of some of the striking landscapes and geographical features he encounters.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Appealing to history buffs and dedicated ramblers alike, Sir Tony Robinson embarks on spectacular walks through some of Britains most historic landscapes in search of the richest stories from Britains past. In each programme, Tony follows a bespoke route that allows him to explore on foot both the history of a particularly colourful historical period or event, and the spectacular landscape in which those events unfolded. The walks are proper expeditions with each one taking Tony several days. With various experts he encounters on the way, Tony reveals and discovers places and their hidden stories that ordinary walkers and ramblers might otherwise miss. And, as well as the history, Tony infuses each walk with an appreciation of some of the striking landscapes and geographical features Britain contains.

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.sub-title: Back To The Clinic Part 1 Revisit
programme.desc: In tonight show theres Adrian whose huge piles were memorably fixed last year - is he still sitting comfortably? While Janice a mastectomy patient, who came to see Dr Christian about a new nipple finally completes the tattoo treatment to give her the result shes dreamed of since losing her breast to cancer. Theyre joined back at the clinic by a case of mortifying flatulence, a young man whose life has been brought to a standstill from extreme shakes and two children from the Kids Specials who are now both recovered from their embarrassing leaks and dribbles.

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.sub-title: Back To The Clinic Part 2 Revisit
programme.desc: In tonights show we revisit John who first came to the clinic with a severe case of anal abscesses. After 15 operations on his anus we see him undergo his final operation and hes coming back to the clinic to let Dr Pixie know if hes now seen the end to his problem. The doctors are also joined by a young lady who had a breast deformity which was taking over her life, a child with a severe infestation of headlice and we find out if a baby who had a serious hip operation is now able to walk. We also revisit Patricia from our Oldies special who was given revolutionary treatment for her bunions, is she now taking steps in the right direction?

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.sub-title: Back To The Clinic Part 3 Revisit
programme.desc: In tonights show we revisit Josh who came to the clinic after suffering from night terrors which were making him talk and shout obscenities in his sleep causing severe sleep deprivation to himself and his distressed wife. With their relationship on the rocks Josh underwent treatment at a sleep clinic and is coming back to the clinic to let Dr Dawn how he and his long suffering wife have been getting on since his treatment. We also revisit Elizabeth who underwent surgery to remove her rotten toenail, we catch up with Lois who suffered for years from persistent thrush. After a series of tests after the programme she was diagnosed with a thyroid problem. Dr Christian also catches up with Brian who came to see him with leaking bowels. After a change of diet and lifestyle we find out if Brian has managed to wipe out his problem for good and we catch up with Barry who underwent surgery for Prostate cancer. The doctors also delve into the world of labia shape and size and use the Embarrassing Bodies website to show worried females that there really is nothing to worry about.

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.sub-title: Back To The Clinic Part 2 Revisit
programme.desc: In tonights show we revisit John who first came to the clinic with a severe case of anal abscesses. After 15 operations on his anus we see him undergo his final operation and hes coming back to the clinic to let Dr Pixie know if hes now seen the end to his problem. The doctors are also joined by a young lady who had a breast deformity which was taking over her life, a child with a severe infestation of headlice and we find out if a baby who had a serious hip operation is now able to walk. We also revisit Patricia from our Oldies special who was given revolutionary treatment for her bunions, is she now taking steps in the right direction?

programme.title: Bondi Rescue

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.sub-title: Back To The Clinic Part 3 Revisit
programme.desc: In tonights show we revisit Josh who came to the clinic after suffering from night terrors which were making him talk and shout obscenities in his sleep causing severe sleep deprivation to himself and his distressed wife. With their relationship on the rocks Josh underwent treatment at a sleep clinic and is coming back to the clinic to let Dr Dawn how he and his long suffering wife have been getting on since his treatment. We also revisit Elizabeth who underwent surgery to remove her rotten toenail, we catch up with Lois who suffered for years from persistent thrush. After a series of tests after the programme she was diagnosed with a thyroid problem. Dr Christian also catches up with Brian who came to see him with leaking bowels. After a change of diet and lifestyle we find out if Brian has managed to wipe out his problem for good and we catch up with Barry who underwent surgery for Prostate cancer. The doctors also delve into the world of labia shape and size and use the Embarrassing Bodies website to show worried females that there really is nothing to worry about.

programme.title: Neighbourhood Wars
programme.desc: With a record number of Americans trading city life for homes in the suburbs, relationships between neighbours are being put to the test. Each half-hour episode of "Neighbourhood Wars" takes viewers into the homes and backyards of neighbours across the country with some of the most unexpected and emotionally charged events caught on camera. Featuring footage from cell phones, drones, home security cameras and more, the series showcases the kindness and conflict between real-life neighbours throughout the US.

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.sub-title: Back To The Clinic Part 3 Revisit
programme.desc: In tonights show we revisit Josh who came to the clinic after suffering from night terrors which were making him talk and shout obscenities in his sleep causing severe sleep deprivation to himself and his distressed wife. With their relationship on the rocks Josh underwent treatment at a sleep clinic and is coming back to the clinic to let Dr Dawn how he and his long suffering wife have been getting on since his treatment. We also revisit Elizabeth who underwent surgery to remove her rotten toenail, we catch up with Lois who suffered for years from persistent thrush. After a series of tests after the programme she was diagnosed with a thyroid problem. Dr Christian also catches up with Brian who came to see him with leaking bowels. After a change of diet and lifestyle we find out if Brian has managed to wipe out his problem for good and we catch up with Barry who underwent surgery for Prostate cancer. The doctors also delve into the world of labia shape and size and use the Embarrassing Bodies website to show worried females that there really is nothing to worry about.

programme.title: Neighbourhood Wars
programme.desc: With a record number of Americans trading city life for homes in the suburbs, relationships between neighbours are being put to the test. Each half-hour episode of "Neighbourhood Wars" takes viewers into the homes and backyards of neighbours across the country with some of the most unexpected and emotionally charged events caught on camera. Featuring footage from cell phones, drones, home security cameras and more, the series showcases the kindness and conflict between real-life neighbours throughout the US.

programme.title: The Change-Up
programme.desc: In this switching places comedy, two best friends wake up in each others bodies after a drunken night, and become very alarmed with the outcome.

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie Bradshaw, successful author and everyones favourite fashion icon-next-door, is back, her famously sardonic wit intact and sharper than ever, as she continues to narrate her own story about sex, love and the fashion-obsessed single woman in New York City. Sex and the City finds Carrie, Samantha, Charlotte, and Miranda four years after the hit series ended, as our favourite friends continue to juggle jobs and relationships while navigating motherhood, marriage and Manhattan real estate.

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: An uncanny presidential lookalike is recruited as a momentary stand-in for Americans Chief Executive. However, things dont turn out exactly as planned, and Dave finds himself continuing the masquerade indefinitely.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Darker
programme.desc: When a wounded Christian Grey tried to entice a cautious Ana Steele back into his life, she demands a new arrangement before she will give him another chance. As the two begin to build trust and find stability, shadowy figures from Christians past start to circle the couple, determined to destroy their hopes for a future together.

programme.title: Mean Girls (2024)
programme.desc: In a musical twist of the cult classic, new student Cady Heron is welcomed by the popular girls called "The Plastics". However, when Cady falls for queen bee Reginas ex-boyfriend, she finds herself in Reginas crosshairs. She must learn to stay true to herself while navigating the most cut throat jungle of all: high school.

programme.title: The American President
programme.desc: Andrew Shepherd is the widowed President of the United States, who decides that its time to get back into the dating game and falls heavily for a feisty political lobbyist. True romance under the scrutiny of the worlds media has a price, and the presidents opponents will use anything to discredit him.

programme.title: Bridget Joness Baby
programme.desc: After breaking up with Mark Darcy, Bridget Joness "happily ever after" hasnt quite gone according to plan. Fortysomething and single again, she decides to focus on her job as top news producer and surround herself with old friends and new. For once, Bridget has everything completely under control. What could possibly go wrong? Then her love life takes a turn and Bridget meets a dashing American named Jack, the suitor who is everything Mr. Darcy is not. In an unlikely twist she finds herself pregnant, but with one hitch she can only be fifty percent sure of the identity of her babys father.

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: A sports agent suddenly discovers his scruples and promptly loses his job. But with the help of one loyal colleague and one outrageous client, he learns that loving well is the best revenge.

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: After discovering that retirement isnt all its cracked up to be, a 70-year-old widower seizes an opportunity to become a senior intern at an online fashion site.

programme.title: Pleasantville
programme.desc: Two modern American teenagers are sucked into their television set and end up living in a black-and-white 50s sitcom.

programme.title: 50 First Dates
programme.desc: Henry lives an enviable life in a Hawaiian paradise, spending every night with a beautiful tourist in search of an island fling. Its a sweet life with no strings attached until he meets Lucy. He and Lucy hit it off from the get-go, but the next day she acts like she doesnt know him. Has his karma come around to kick him in the butt or what? Actually, Lucy has short-term memory loss so every night all memory of her day is erased. But a man in love will go to any lengths to win over the girl of his dreams, and if that means having to find imaginative ways of doing it over again every day, then Henrys up for the challenge.

programme.title: Something to Talk About
programme.desc: A contemporary Southern wife and mother has the perfect life. But when she learns that her husband has been unfaithful, she steps back and examines her life from a new perspective.

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: Anna Scott is the worlds most famous movie star. Her picture has been plastered on the cover of every magazine, and every time she makes a movie, the entire world knows about it. William Thacker owns a travel bookstore in the quaint neighbourhood of Notting Hill. His business is stagnant, he has the roommate from hell and his love life is completely non-existent. Then one day, their paths cross and the couple comes to face the ultimate question: can two people fall in love with the whole world watching?

programme.title: Sex Diaries
programme.desc: Chronicles eight New Yorkers in short, intimate profiles as they navigate sex and dating in the city. As the diarists recount the ups and downs of their experiences, the verite portraits are woven together with video diaries that share personal reflections on dating, cultivating relationships, and exploring sexual desire - and also include check-ins with Alyssa Shelasky, editor of New York Magazines "Sex Diaries" column. A contemporary look at a search for connection, this four-part docuseries offers a range of unique explorations of sex, intimacy, and relationships today.

programme.title: Wentworth
programme.desc: Ferguson, having found protection in Kazs crew, cunningly blames Will for her brutal ganging, a move which only strengthens Kazs support for her. When Bea defends Will, it backfires dramatically. She is painted as a screw-lover, and rapidly begins to lose the support of the women. The first-ever conjugal visit takes place at the prison, and Boomer shamelessly attempts to impregnate herself to her deadbeat ex-boyfriend, Daz. Meanwhile, Maxine is diagnosed with breast cancer and cant bring herself to tell the other women.

programme.title: Wentworth
programme.desc: With Bea in the slot, Ferguson intensifies her manipulation of Kaz. Seizing on the recent death of her father that sends Kaz into an inexplicable spiral, Ferguson realises that Kaz was a victim of abuse at his hands. Ferguson uses her own troubled relationship with her father as a means of forming a closer bond with Kaz. When new Indigenous inmate Tasha is put under Doreens care, Ferguson sees an opportunity to force Kaz into action against Bea. With Maxine as acting top dog, Ferguson places Tasha in Lucys orbit and when Tasha breaks the rules by protecting herself from Lucys molestation, Maxine appears to have no choice but to punish Tasha. Ferguson urges Kaz to stand up to Maxine and save the innocent girl from abuse at the hands of a man, thereby tapping into Kazs past trauma. Bea and Allys bond is cemented when they are slotted in adjoining cells and spend hours talking.

programme.title: Sex Diaries
programme.desc: Chronicles eight New Yorkers in short, intimate profiles as they navigate sex and dating in the city. As the diarists recount the ups and downs of their experiences, the verite portraits are woven together with video diaries that share personal reflections on dating, cultivating relationships, and exploring sexual desire - and also include check-ins with Alyssa Shelasky, editor of New York Magazines "Sex Diaries" column. A contemporary look at a search for connection, this four-part docuseries offers a range of unique explorations of sex, intimacy, and relationships today.

programme.title: Wentworth
programme.desc: With Bea in the slot, Ferguson intensifies her manipulation of Kaz. Seizing on the recent death of her father that sends Kaz into an inexplicable spiral, Ferguson realises that Kaz was a victim of abuse at his hands. Ferguson uses her own troubled relationship with her father as a means of forming a closer bond with Kaz. When new Indigenous inmate Tasha is put under Doreens care, Ferguson sees an opportunity to force Kaz into action against Bea. With Maxine as acting top dog, Ferguson places Tasha in Lucys orbit and when Tasha breaks the rules by protecting herself from Lucys molestation, Maxine appears to have no choice but to punish Tasha. Ferguson urges Kaz to stand up to Maxine and save the innocent girl from abuse at the hands of a man, thereby tapping into Kazs past trauma. Bea and Allys bond is cemented when they are slotted in adjoining cells and spend hours talking.
